org.ejvm.compilation

Class EjvmCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.compilation.EjvmCompiler

  • public class EjvmCompiler
extends Object

    The EjvmCompiler provides methods to compile eJVM source code into an eJVM Executable File.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe
    See Also:
    compile(InputStream, OutputStream)

      Creates a new EjvmCompiler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EjvmCompiler

        public EjvmCompiler()

        Creates a new EjvmCompiler. Debug information will not be omitted. Compiler messages will be sent to System.out.

      • EjvmCompiler

        public EjvmCompiler(boolean omitDebugInformation)

        Creates a new EjvmCompiler. Compiler messages will be sent to System.out.

        Parameters:
        omitDebugInformation - The compiler will not include debug information in the executable if this is true.

    • Method Detail

      • setOmitDebugInformation

        public void setOmitDebugInformation(boolean omit)

        Sets if the compiler will omit debug information from the executable compiled.

        Parameters:
        omit - true if the compiler shall not include debug information.

      • omitsDebugInformation

        public boolean omitsDebugInformation()

        Returns true if the compiler will omit debug information from the executable compiled.

        Returns:
        true if the compiler will not compile debug information; otherwise false.

      • setMessageOut

        public void setMessageOut(PrintStream msgOut)

        Replaces the PrintStream used by the compiler to write compiler messages to (e.g. warnings) with msgOut. By default, the compiler writes its messages to System.out.

        Parameters:
        msgOut - The new output channel for compiler messages.

      • compile

        public void compile(InputStream src,
           OutputStream out)
             throws IOException,
                    EjvmCompilationException

        Invoking this method will try to parse and compile the eJVM program available from src, with the compiled executable written to out.

        Compiler messages, such as warnings, will be written to the message output of this compiler (default: System.out). Use setMessageOut(PrintStream) to replace this with another output channel.

        Invoking this method several times is possible without having to create a new EjvmCompiler instance.

        Parameters:
        src - The InputStream to read the eJVM program from.
        out - The OutputStream into which the compiled executable will be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - In case of any I/O-related error.
        EjvmCompilationException - Thrown when the compiler encounters erroneous code.
